Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic and Michael Porter Jr had big nights
Denver Nuggets let their foot off the gas defensively in the second half
Phoenix Suns took advantage and got all the way back to tying the game at 71
Colin Gillespie responded for Phoenix with a 10-0 run and got the lead back
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns rested their entire starting lineup while the Nuggets used the game as an opportunity to get their regular rotation an extended look
Russell Westbrook and Julian Strawther were the first players off the bench
Denver had their outside shot going early on while Phoenix had theirs, but Porter Jr. was the exception
Denver's bench plus Braun closed out the quarter with a 33-26 lead
The Suns stayed hot from the field to start the second quarter while Tyson took some early threes that only found iron
Russell Westbrook and Julian Strawther played well against the Suns' deep bench
The Suns took the lead before Denver answered by pushing the fastbreak
Zeke Nnaji had some good minutes in the fourth, hitting a three with just over a minute left and then bullying in for a layup to pull Denver within three
Post-Match Reflections: The high level play came from the wings tonight, with Julian Strawther and Ryan Dunn performing well
Julian Strawther knocked down shots and attacked the basket, providing a big boost for the Nuggets bench unit
Ryan Dunn was on fire seemingly all night long, hitting six three pointers and tallying twenty points
The twenty-eighth overall pick may not be in the Suns rotation come the start of the regular season, but he’s making a case for real playing time
Nikola Jokic had a master-class performance
Denver's offense consisted of setting up outside shots for their bigs which did not yield great results
Jamal Murray only played a half due to his knee not feeling right
Denver has yet to win a game this preseason but color me not all that concerned
The most glaring hole right now seems to be in the backup forward spot

The Nuggets look pretty much ready to roll with Jokic in MVP form, the bench additions plus Strawther’s growth making for a potent second unit, and Braun fitting in just fine as the starting two guard
The lack of playable point guards on the Nuggets roster later in the game was highlighted
The Nuggets starters struggled against the Phoenix bench, but it was expected as it was preseason
Malone said in the press conference that he wasn’t happy with their conditioning and ran the starters in the 3rd quarter as a result
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns had their outside shot going early on and the Nuggets were cold
Porter Jr. was in his bag tonight, having his standard long distance sniper game going
Nikola Jokic looked in MVP form, with added muscle from the offseason making him a difficult player to defend
The Suns had their outside shot going early on and the Nuggets were cold
The game stayed tight as Phoenix still had the three point shot working
Denver’s offense consisted of setting up outside shots for their bigs which did not yield great results
The Nuggets bench plus Braun closed out the quarter with a 33-26 lead
Ryan Dunn kept hitting threes though and Denver was running out of time
Zeke Nnaji had some good minutes in the fourth, hitting a three with just over a minute left and then bullying in for a layup to pull Denver within three
Dunn got the last laugh, burying a dagger three with just over twenty seconds to go
